TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE . He is currently serving a prison sentence in GPE .

CARDINAL . Late on TIME CARDINAL DATE the applicant was arrested by the police at the scene of a crime on suspicion of having set fire to his mother 's flat . His mother died in the fire and another person , PERSON , received serious injuries . The applicant was taken to the police department of the village of GPE in GPE .
CARDINAL . According to the applicant , while he was at the police department CARDINAL of the policemen kicked him twice in the chest .

CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the applicant was examined by a doctor , who noted a bruise on his head . The applicant stated that he had also complained of pain in the chest but that his chest had not been examined .

CARDINAL . After the examination the applicant was transferred to the police department of the town of Pervouralsk . According to the applicant , while he was at the police department he was kicked in the legs , kidneys , chest and ribs by CARDINAL policemen .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was questioned by the investigator . He denied involvement in the arson attack and stated that he had been attacked by CARDINAL strangers who had assaulted him and set fire to the flat . He was subsequently put in a cell in the temporary detention unit of ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE Mr L. was appointed as legal aid counsel for the applicant . The applicant asked the investigator and PERSON to arrange a medical examination . The investigator refused his request .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was escorted to detention facility no . CARDINAL in PERSON . However , he was not admitted to the detention facility because he did not have a medical certificate . He was brought back to PERSON .

CARDINAL . On DATE he was again escorted to detention facility no . CARDINAL in GPE , where DATE for the second time – he was refused admittance without a medical certificate . On his return to PERSON , he was examined by a doctor , who noted a bruise on his chest . On DATE a chest X - ray was performed . On DATE all the X - ray photographs revealing no injuries , including the X - ray photograph of the applicant 's chest , were destroyed by the medical staff of ORG . CARDINAL . A certificate issued by the chief physician of ORG No . CARDINAL on DATE confirmed that the X - ray had revealed no injury to the applicant 's chest .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was admitted to detention facility no . CARDINAL in GPE , where he was examined by a doctor . The doctor noted CARDINAL bruises on the applicant 's forehead and a bruise on his chest . When asked by the doctor about the origin of the bruises , the applicant replied that they had been received outside detention facility no . CARDINAL . He signed a statement that he had no complaints and that there was no need for an investigation .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant complained to the prosecutor , alleging ill - treatment .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG town prosecutor refused to open criminal proceedings . Having reviewed the reports on the applicant 's arrest and questioning , he found that the applicant 's head had already been injured when the police arrived at the crime scene . The applicant had himself stated to the investigator that he had been assaulted by strangers before the arrest , which provided sufficient explanation for his injuries . There was no evidence that he had been ill - treated by the police .

CARDINAL . Following communication of the application , an internal inquiry was conducted in DATE . On DATE the head of ORG of ORG found that the applicant had himself affirmed that he had been beaten by strangers prior to the arrest . The strangers had been identified and questioned . They were the applicant 's neighbours , who had come running to put out the fire in his flat . They had tried to rescue the applicant 's mother from the burning flat , but the applicant had attempted to stop them and subsequently attacked them with an axe . They had had to use force to disarm him . A fight had followed , in the course of which the applicant had been injured . Those facts had been taken into account by the prosecutor , who had refused to open criminal proceedings , finding that the allegations of ill - treatment by the police had been unsubstantiated .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the case was referred for trial to ORG , where PERSON was appointed as legal aid counsel for the applicant .

CARDINAL . The applicant stated that on DATE he had asked the court to provide him with a hearing aid and arrange a meeting with counsel . No response had been received . The Government claimed that no such requests had been made .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , in CARDINAL hearing , found the applicant guilty of aggravated murder , causing bodily harm and intentional destruction of another 's property and sentenced him DATE taking account of his previous criminal record DATE imprisonment in a high - security colony .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged an appeal , challenging statements by witnesses and the accuracy of their transcription in the trial record . He advanced the defence of irresistible impulse and asked the court to adopt a different legal characterisation of the imputed offence . He also asked to be given an opportunity to be present at the appeal hearing . On DATE he lodged annex no . CARDINAL to his grounds of appeal , concerning the interpretation of the facts .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE held , in an interim decision , that the applicant should be present at the hearing .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant asked ORG to appoint legal aid counsel for him .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant submitted annex no . CARDINAL to his grounds of appeal , in which he complained of procedural shortcomings of the trial , including ineffective representation by counsel PERSON and NORP , who had never backed his requests and applications . He further complained that the trial court had refused to provide him with a hearing aid and that counsel NORP had failed to support his request to that effect . He also submitted that he had been ill - treated on DATE of the arrest and alleged that the investigator had withdrawn the medical certificate of CARDINAL DATE and his X - ray photograph from the case file . Finally , he asked ORG to inform lawyers from GPE bar association no . CARDINAL , ORG and FAC of the date of the appeal hearing .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged annex no . CARDINAL to his grounds of appeal , in which he asked , in particular , for legal representation before the appeal court , indicating that he had no legal training and was “ half deaf ” .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG sent telegrams to Pervouralsk bar association no . CARDINAL , ORG no . CARDINAL , ORG and FAC , informing them that the appeal hearing in the applicant 's case would be held on DATE at TIME The telegrams indicated that attendance was not mandatory .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE held the appeal hearing and upheld the judgment of DATE . The applicant was present but not represented . The appeal judgment was silent on the issue of providing the applicant with a hearing aid . As regards the applicant 's right to a defence , the judgment read as follows :

“ It can be seen from the case materials that [ the applicant ] was represented by Counsel PERSON during the pre - trial investigation and Counsel PERSON during the trial . He did not refuse the services of these counsel . There are no reasons to believe that they defended his interests improperly , nor do the grounds of appeal indicate any such reasons . ”

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant complained to the Presidium of ORG of GPE about , in particular , the appeal court 's refusal to provide him with legal representation . On DATE Judge PERSON responded that there were no grounds on which to institute supervisory review proceedings in respect of the judgments in his case .
CARDINAL . A certificate of DATE issued by a doctor of the medical unit of facility no . ORG indicates that the applicant suffers from chronic bilateral sensorineural hearing impairment .

CARDINAL . The RSFSR Code of Criminal Procedure ( in force until DATE ) establishes that the investigator or the court shall provide the suspect or the accused with legal aid counsel at his request . In cases where counsel chosen by the accused is not available for a long period of time , the investigator or the court may suggest that the accused choose another counsel or , alternatively , appoint another counsel for the accused ( Article CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . Counsel must imperatively be appointed by the investigator or the court if , in particular , the accused is mute , deaf or blind or if he can not defend himself on account of a physical or mental impairment ( Article CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . ORG notifies participants in criminal proceedings of the dates of appeal hearings at their request . The non - appearance by participants who have been notified of the date of the appeal hearing does not preclude the examination of the case ( Article CARDINAL ) .
